channel.title: The After On Podcast
channel.itunes:summary: We dive deep into the science, tech, and social issues explored in the novel "After On." It's NOT necessary to be an "After On" reader to listen, learn & enjoy this podcast!
channel.itunes:author: Rob Reid
channel.description: We dive deep into the science, tech, and social issues explored in the novel "After On." It's NOT necessary to be an "After On" reader to listen, learn & enjoy this podcast!
channel.itunes:subtitle: Deep Dives into Tech & Science with Author Rob Reid

item.title: 58: Recipes for Future Plagues | Kevin Esvelt
item.itunes:title: Recipes for Future Plagues | Kevin Esvelt
item.description: USAID’s new “DEEP VZN” program aims to discover new pandemic-grade viruses, then broadcast their genomes to the world, according to MIT evolutionary engineer Kevin Esvelt. He estimates that 30,000 people in dozens of countries could then easily assemble them.
item.content:encoded: USAID’s new “DEEP VZN” program aims to discover new pandemic-grade viruses, then broadcast their genomes to the world, according to MIT evolutionary engineer Kevin Esvelt. He estimates that 30,000 people in dozens of countries could then easily assemble them.

item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 57: Octopus Intelligence (and more!) | Roger Hanlon
item.itunes:title: Octopus Intelligence (and more!) | Roger Hanlon
item.description: A wide-ranging discussion of cognition in octopuses & cuttlefish, plus many, many other topics with globally renowned sensory ecologist Roger Hanlon.
item.content:encoded: A wide-ranging discussion of cognition in octopuses & cuttlefish, plus many, many other topics with globally renowned sensory ecologist Roger Hanlon.
item.itunes:subtitle: A wide-ranging discussion of cognition in octopuses & cuttlefish, plus many, many other topics with globally renowned sensory ecologist Roger Hanlon.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 56: A Massive Future for an Old Vaccine? | Megan Murray
item.itunes:title: A Massive Future for an Old Vaccine? | Megan Murray
item.description: Harvard epidemiologist Megan Murray tells us all about the anti-tuberculosis vaccine “BCG,” and the astonishing protection it may provide against Covid -- as well as looming future pandemics.
item.content:encoded: Harvard epidemiologist Megan Murray tells us all about the anti-tuberculosis vaccine “BCG,” and the astonishing protection it may provide against Covid -- as well as looming future pandemics.
item.itunes:subtitle: Harvard epidemiologist Megan Murray tells us all about the anti-tuberculosis vaccine “BCG,” and the astonishing protection it may provide against Covid -- as well as looming future pandemics.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 55: Detecting Disease Outbreaks from Internet Traffic | Seth Stephens-Davidowitz
item.itunes:title: Detecting Disease Outbreaks from Internet Traffic | Seth Stephens-Davidowitz
item.description: This is closely tied to a 4-hour collaboration between Sam Harris and me, which Sam is posting to his podcast's feed. I strongly recommend that episode too! But it's not "required" for you to get everything out of this fascinating conversation with Seth.
item.content:encoded: This is closely tied to a 4-hour collaboration between Sam Harris and me, which Sam is posting to his podcast's feed. I strongly recommend that episode too! But it's not "required" for you to get everything out of this fascinating conversation with Seth.

item.title: 54: Announcing a New Season
item.itunes:title: Announcing a New Season
item.description: This "episode" is just a quick new announcement of a new season of the podcast (finally)! And also of something very cool that I'm working on with fellow podcaster Sam Harris.
item.content:encoded: This "episode" is just a quick new announcement of a new season of the podcast (finally)! And also of something very cool that I'm working on with fellow podcaster Sam Harris.
item.itunes:subtitle: This "episode" is just a quick new announcement of a new season of the podcast (finally)! And also of something very cool that I'm working on with fellow podcaster Sam Harris.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 53: The Case Against Reality | Don Hoffman (classic + updated)
item.itunes:title: The Case Against Reality | Don Hoffman (classic + updated)
item.description: Quantitative Psychologist Don Hoffman has a head-spinning take on the true nature of reality vs. what our senses report to us. This is a revisitation of our original interview, expanded with lots of new material recorded last week.
item.content:encoded: Quantitative Psychologist Don Hoffman has a head-spinning take on the true nature of reality vs. what our senses report to us. This is a revisitation of our original interview, expanded with lots of new material recorded last week.
item.itunes:subtitle: Quantitative Psychologist Don Hoffman has a head-spinning take on the true nature of reality vs. what our senses report to us. This is a revisitation of our original interview, expanded with lots of new material recorded last week.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 52: Many Quantum Worlds | Sean Carroll
item.itunes:title: Many Quantum Worlds | Sean Carroll
item.description: Quantum mechanics – and its eerie "Many Worlds" interpretation – are explored in terms that both poets & physicists can appreciate.
item.content:encoded: Quantum mechanics – and its eerie "Many Worlds" interpretation – are explored in terms that both poets & physicists can appreciate.
item.itunes:subtitle: Quantum mechanics – and its eerie "Many Worlds" interpretation – are explored in terms that both poets & physicists can appreciate.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 51: On Consciousness | Annaka Harris
item.itunes:title: On Consciousness | Annaka Harris
item.description: The baffling and fascinating mysteries connected to the phenomenon of consciousness are explored in this conversation with the deeply thoughtful science writer, Annaka Harris.
item.content:encoded: The baffling and fascinating mysteries connected to the phenomenon of consciousness are explored in this conversation with the deeply thoughtful science writer, Annaka Harris.
item.itunes:subtitle: The baffling and fascinating mysteries connected to the phenomenon of consciousness are explored in this conversation with the deeply thoughtful science writer, Annaka Harris.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 50: About that TED Talk | Kevin Rose
item.itunes:title: About that TED Talk | Kevin Rose
item.description: This morning, TED posted a talk I just gave at their annual conference (on 11 days notice!). Kevin Rose interviewed me about my talk for his podcast. I’m posting his interview here as well.
item.content:encoded: This morning, TED posted a talk I just gave at their annual conference (on 11 days notice!). Kevin Rose interviewed me about my talk for his podcast. I’m posting his interview here as well.

item.title: 49: Canceling PTSD with MDMA (part 2) | Rick Doblin
item.itunes:title: Canceling PTSD with MDMA (part 2) | Rick Doblin
item.description: The drug known as Molly, Ecstasy and MDMA may soon get regulatory approved for therapeutic use, thanks to a 34-year campaign waged by Rick Doblin. Rick and I discuss all of this, plus his own unique story.
item.content:encoded: The drug known as Molly, Ecstasy and MDMA may soon get regulatory approved for therapeutic use, thanks to a 34-year campaign waged by Rick Doblin. Rick and I discuss all of this, plus his own unique story.
item.itunes:subtitle: The drug known as Molly, Ecstasy and MDMA may soon get regulatory approved for therapeutic use, thanks to a 34-year campaign waged by Rick Doblin. Rick and I discuss all of this, plus his own unique story.

item.title: 48: Canceling PTSD with MDMA (part 1) | Rick Doblin
item.itunes:title: Canceling PTSD with MDMA (part 1) | Rick Doblin
item.description: The drug known as Molly, Ecstasy and MDMA may soon get regulatory approved for therapeutic use, thanks to a 34-year campaign waged by Rick Doblin. Rick and I discuss all of this, plus his own unique story.

item.title: 47. AI Boom, or Doom? | Stuart Russell
item.itunes:title: AI Boom, or Doom? | Stuart Russell
item.description: Stuart Russell’s textbook is used to teach AI in over 1,400 universities and 120 countries. If AI scares him, it should scare you too.
item.content:encoded: Stuart Russell’s textbook is used to teach AI in over 1,400 universities and 120 countries. If AI scares him, it should scare you too.
item.itunes:subtitle: Stuart Russell’s textbook is used to teach AI in over 1,400 universities and 120 countries. If AI scares him, it should scare you too.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 46: Defeating Food Allergies | Kari Nadeau
item.itunes:title: Defeating Food Allergies | Kari Nadeau
item.description: The food allergy epidemic is mysterious, volatile, and growing fast. Kari Nadeau and her Stanford team are trying to halt it.
item.content:encoded: The food allergy epidemic is mysterious, volatile, and growing fast. Kari Nadeau and her Stanford team are trying to halt it.
item.itunes:subtitle: The food allergy epidemic is mysterious, volatile, and growing fast. Kari Nadeau and her Stanford team are trying to halt it.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 45: End Games (part 2) | Naval Ravikant
item.itunes:title: End Games (part 2) | Naval Ravikant
item.description: A rampage killer with a knife can kill a few. With a gun, dozens. With a jetliner, way more. What might future tech enable? In Part Two of our conversation, Naval and I discuss "The Ender."And how to preclude this monstrosity.
item.content:encoded: A rampage killer with a knife can kill a few. With a gun, dozens. With a jetliner, way more. What might future tech enable? In Part Two of our conversation, Naval and I discuss "The Ender."And how to preclude this monstrosity.

item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 44: End Games (part 1) | Naval Ravikant
item.itunes:title: End Games (part 1) | Naval Ravikant
item.description: Naval & I discuss a horrifying risk. We questioned whether to post this. Might it give someone ideas? Well, the bad guys already HAVE ideas. And cataclysms are only averted if we face them. There’s still time.
item.content:encoded: Naval & I discuss a horrifying risk. We questioned whether to post this. Might it give someone ideas? Well, the bad guys already HAVE ideas. And cataclysms are only averted if we face them. There’s still time.
item.itunes:subtitle: Naval & I discuss a horrifying risk. We questioned whether to post this. Might it give someone ideas? Well, the bad guys already HAVE ideas. And cataclysms are only averted if we face them. There’s still time.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 43: Synthetic Neurobiology | Ed Boyden
item.itunes:title: Synthetic Neurobiology | Ed Boyden
item.description: Not yet 40, Ed Boyden has already concocted a panoply of tools, which are revolutionizing neuroscience research. He tells us all about optogenetics, expansion microscopy, and more.
item.content:encoded: Not yet 40, Ed Boyden has already concocted a panoply of tools, which are revolutionizing neuroscience research. He tells us all about optogenetics, expansion microscopy, and more.
item.itunes:subtitle: Not yet 40, Ed Boyden has already concocted a panoply of tools, which are revolutionizing neuroscience research. He tells us all about optogenetics, expansion microscopy, and more.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 42: Live from Gainesville + the 2019 Plan
item.itunes:title: Live from Gainesville + the 2019 Plan
item.description: We start with a review of this podcast's 2019 roadmap. Then – recorded before a live audience in Gainesville, Florida – I'M the interviewee for once!
item.content:encoded: We start with a review of this podcast's 2019 roadmap. Then – recorded before a live audience in Gainesville, Florida – I'M the interviewee for once!

item.title: 41: The Medical Potential of Video Games | Adam Gazzaley
item.itunes:title: The Medical Potential of Video Games | Adam Gazzaley
item.description: Both a recap and extensive update of last summer's conversation about neuroscience, consciousness, and the medical potential of video games.
item.content:encoded: Both a recap and extensive update of last summer's conversation about neuroscience, consciousness, and the medical potential of video games.
item.itunes:subtitle: Both a recap and extensive update of last summer's conversation about neuroscience, consciousness, and the medical potential of video games.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 40: Our Interstellar Visitor | Avi Loeb
item.itunes:title: Our Interstellar Visitor | Avi Loeb
item.description: Did the product of an alien intelligence make a near-Earth approach last fall? Harvard Astronomy Department Chair Avi Loeb believes this is possible.
item.content:encoded: Did the product of an alien intelligence make a near-Earth approach last fall? Harvard Astronomy Department Chair Avi Loeb believes this is possible.
item.itunes:subtitle: Did the product of an alien intelligence make a near-Earth approach last fall? Harvard Astronomy Department Chair Avi Loeb believes this is possible.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 39: Restoring Sight to the Blind | EJ Chichinilsky
item.itunes:title: Restoring Sight to the Blind | EJ Chichinilsky
item.description: Amazing work at Stanford could restore vision to the blind. Then later become a gateway some mind-blowing neural augmentation! We discuss the astounding neuroscience and engineering behind all this, with the professor who's making it happen.
item.content:encoded: Amazing work at Stanford could restore vision to the blind. Then later become a gateway some mind-blowing neural augmentation! We discuss the astounding neuroscience and engineering behind all this, with the professor who's making it happen.
item.itunes:subtitle: Amazing work at Stanford could restore vision to the blind. Then later become a gateway some mind-blowing neural augmentation! We discuss the astounding neuroscience and engineering behind all this, with the professor who's making it happen.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 38: The Science & Practice of Happiness | Laurie Santos
item.itunes:title: The Science & Practice of Happiness | Laurie Santos
item.description: This spring, Yale evolutionary psychologist Laurie Santos debuted a course about happiness, almost as an experiment. It became the most popular course in the university's 300+ year history. Listen carefully, because this episode could make you happier!
item.content:encoded: This spring, Yale evolutionary psychologist Laurie Santos debuted a course about happiness, almost as an experiment. It became the most popular course in the university's 300+ year history. Listen carefully, because this episode could make you happier!
item.itunes:subtitle: This spring, Yale evolutionary psychologist Laurie Santos debuted a course about happiness, almost as an experiment. It became the most popular course in the university's 300+ year history. Listen carefully, because this episode could make you happier!
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 37. On the Future | Astronomer Royal Martin Rees
item.itunes:title: On the Future | Astronomer Royal Martin Rees
item.description: Can humankind survive this century? Great Britain’s Astronomer Royal Martin Rees shares some of his profoundly original thinking on this fraught question.
item.content:encoded: Can humankind survive this century? Great Britain’s Astronomer Royal Martin Rees shares some of his profoundly original thinking on this fraught question.
item.itunes:subtitle: Can humankind survive this century? Great Britain’s Astronomer Royal Martin Rees shares some of his profoundly original thinking on this fraught question.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 36. Mapping the Heavens | Priya Natarajan
item.itunes:title: Mapping the Heavens | Priya Natarajan
item.description: Dark matter, dark energy, and black holes are the universe's three most massive mysteries. Literally! Yale astrophysicist Priya Natarajan takes us on a fascinating tour of them all.
item.content:encoded: Dark matter, dark energy, and black holes are the universe's three most massive mysteries. Literally! Yale astrophysicist Priya Natarajan takes us on a fascinating tour of them all.
item.itunes:subtitle: Dark matter, dark energy, and black holes are the universe's three most massive mysteries. Literally! Yale astrophysicist Priya Natarajan takes us on a fascinating tour of them all.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 35: Empowering the Acre | Andrew Youn
item.itunes:title: Empowering the Acre | Andrew Youn
item.description: Andrew Youn's One Acre Found is bringing food security to hundreds of thousands of families throughout Central Africa. Now THAT'S an inspiring startup!
item.content:encoded: Andrew Youn's One Acre Found is bringing food security to hundreds of thousands of families throughout Central Africa. Now THAT'S an inspiring startup!
item.itunes:subtitle: Andrew Youn's One Acre Found is bringing food security to hundreds of thousands of families throughout Central Africa. Now THAT'S an inspiring startup!
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 34: Ancient DNA | David Reich
item.itunes:title: Ancient DNA | David Reich
item.description: The genetic code of Neanderthals, archaic humans, and other elders is reconfiguring much of our understanding of human history. And it could just save hundreds of thousands of modern human lives per year.
item.content:encoded: The genetic code of Neanderthals, archaic humans, and other elders is reconfiguring much of our understanding of human history. And it could just save hundreds of thousands of modern human lives per year.
item.itunes:subtitle: The genetic code of Neanderthals, archaic humans, and other elders is reconfiguring much of our understanding of human history. And it could just save hundreds of thousands of modern human lives per year.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 33: The Evolution of Beauty | Richard Prum
item.itunes:title: The Evolution of Beauty | Richard Prum
item.description: A bold and brilliant refutation of the common wisdom about sexual attraction, aesthetics, and more. Rick Prum is an evolutionary heretic. And the wellspring of his unorthodox ideas is ... Charles Darwin himself.
item.content:encoded: A bold and brilliant refutation of the common wisdom about sexual attraction, aesthetics, and more. Rick Prum is an evolutionary heretic. And the wellspring of his unorthodox ideas is ... Charles Darwin himself.
item.itunes:subtitle: A bold and brilliant refutation of the common wisdom about sexual attraction, aesthetics, and more. Rick Prum is an evolutionary heretic. And the wellspring of his unorthodox ideas is ... Charles Darwin himself.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: Announcement | On the Future of this Podcast
item.itunes:title: Announcement | On the Future of this Podcast
item.description: The full lowdown on where this podcast is going from here.
item.content:encoded: The full lowdown on where this podcast is going from here.
item.itunes:subtitle: The full lowdown on where this podcast is going from here.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 31: Expanding DNA's Alphabet (by half!) | Floyd Romesberg
item.itunes:title: Expanding DNA's Alphabet (by half!) | Floyd Romesberg
item.description: Floyd Romesberg added two letters to DNA's ancient four-letter alphabet. He got this running in cells. And coding proteins. His cell lines have passed it down hundreds of generations. Now what?
item.content:encoded: Floyd Romesberg added two letters to DNA's ancient four-letter alphabet. He got this running in cells. And coding proteins. His cell lines have passed it down hundreds of generations. Now what?
item.itunes:subtitle: Floyd Romesberg added two letters to DNA's ancient four-letter alphabet. He got this running in cells. And coding proteins. His cell lines have passed it down hundreds of generations. Now what?
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 30. De-extinction, The Whole Earth, and Way More|Stewart Brand
item.itunes:title: De-extinction, The Whole Earth, and Way More|Stewart Brand
item.description: Over six consecutive decades, Stewart Brand has impacted society, tech and science in outlandishly diverse ways. This truly unhurried conversation explores the scope of his intensely original American life.
item.content:encoded: Over six consecutive decades, Stewart Brand has impacted society, tech and science in outlandishly diverse ways. This truly unhurried conversation explores the scope of his intensely original American life.
item.itunes:subtitle: Over six consecutive decades, Stewart Brand has impacted society, tech and science in outlandishly diverse ways. This truly unhurried conversation explores the scope of his intensely original American life.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: Jordan Harbinger | Bonus Episode
item.itunes:title: Jordan Harbinger | Bonus Episode
item.description: An examination of the science of psychopathy from my buddy Jordan Harbinger’s terrific podcast. This bonus episode is in addition to the two new original episodes I’m creating this month.
item.content:encoded: An examination of the science of psychopathy from my buddy Jordan Harbinger’s terrific podcast. This bonus episode is in addition to the two new original episodes I’m creating this month.
item.itunes:subtitle: An examination of the science of psychopathy from my buddy Jordan Harbinger’s terrific podcast. This bonus episode is in addition to the two new original episodes I’m creating this month.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 28: Exponential Medicine | Daniel Kraft
item.itunes:title: Exponential Medicine | Daniel Kraft
item.description: Key aspects of medical technology are improving even faster than computers. What are the ramifications for our health? For our lifespans? Dr. Daniel Kraft has tremendous insights into all of this - particularly as it relates to cancer.
item.content:encoded: Key aspects of medical technology are improving even faster than computers. What are the ramifications for our health? For our lifespans? Dr. Daniel Kraft has tremendous insights into all of this - particularly as it relates to cancer.
item.itunes:subtitle: Key aspects of medical technology are improving even faster than computers. What are the ramifications for our health? For our lifespans? Dr. Daniel Kraft has tremendous insights into all of this - particularly as it relates to cancer.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 27. Depression: The Psychedelic Cure | Katya Malievskaia & George Goldsmith
item.itunes:title: Depression: The Psychedelic Cure | Katya Malievskaia & George Goldsmith
item.description: The largest-ever clinical trial of a psychedelic drug will soon begin in Europe and North America. The drug is psilocybin - the active ingredient in magic mushrooms. The target is treatment-resistant depression.
item.content:encoded: The largest-ever clinical trial of a psychedelic drug will soon begin in Europe and North America. The drug is psilocybin - the active ingredient in magic mushrooms. The target is treatment-resistant depression.
item.itunes:subtitle: The largest-ever clinical trial of a psychedelic drug will soon begin in Europe and North America. The drug is psilocybin - the active ingredient in magic mushrooms. The target is treatment-resistant depression.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 26: Reality Isn't | Don Hoffman
item.itunes:title: Reality Isn't | Don Hoffman
item.description: Quantitative Psychologist Don Hoffman has a head-spinning take on the true nature of reality vs. what our senses report to us. Is it the most counterintuitive insight since Pythagoras figured the Earth is round?
item.content:encoded: Quantitative Psychologist Don Hoffman has a head-spinning take on the true nature of reality vs. what our senses report to us. Is it the most counterintuitive insight since Pythagoras figured the Earth is round?
item.itunes:subtitle: Quantitative Psychologist Don Hoffman has a head-spinning take on the true nature of reality vs. what our senses report to us. Is it the most counterintuitive insight since Pythagoras figured the Earth is round?
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 25. A Night at the Battery
item.itunes:title: A Night at the Battery
item.description: In this very atypical episode, the tables turn and I'm the interviewee! We discuss all of my creative projects, including this podcast series. Recorded live at The Battery in San Francisco.
item.content:encoded: In this very atypical episode, the tables turn and I'm the interviewee! We discuss all of my creative projects, including this podcast series. Recorded live at The Battery in San Francisco.
item.itunes:subtitle: In this very atypical episode, the tables turn and I'm the interviewee! We discuss all of my creative projects, including this podcast series. Recorded live at The Battery in San Francisco.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 24: BioEngineering |George Church
item.itunes:title: BioEngineering |George Church
item.description: George Church helped found 22 companies, and co-invented the paradigm-shattering gene editing technique CRISPR. In our interview, he delivers a sweeping survey of the world of synthetic biology, and makes some astounding predictions
item.content:encoded: George Church helped found 22 companies, and co-invented the paradigm-shattering gene editing technique CRISPR. In our interview, he delivers a sweeping survey of the world of synthetic biology, and makes some astounding predictions
item.itunes:subtitle: George Church helped found 22 companies, and co-invented the paradigm-shattering gene editing technique CRISPR. In our interview, he delivers a sweeping survey of the world of synthetic biology, and makes some astounding predictions
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 23: AI & Robotics - Their Present and Future| Rodney Brooks
item.itunes:title: AI & Robotics - Their Present and Future| Rodney Brooks
item.description: Rodney Brooks is a founding luminary of TWO vital domains in tech: robotics and AI. He's the father of the Roomba, the long-time head of MIT's AI lab, and a serial entrepreneur. Few can rival his breadth & depth in technology.
item.content:encoded: Rodney Brooks is a founding luminary of TWO vital domains in tech: robotics and AI. He's the father of the Roomba, the long-time head of MIT's AI lab, and a serial entrepreneur. Few can rival his breadth & depth in technology.

item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 22: Creating the 6th, 7th & 8th Sense | David Eagleman
item.itunes:title: Creating the 6th, 7th & 8th Sense | David Eagleman
item.description: Neuroscientist David Eagleman has done groundbreaking work on how we perceive time. Now he hopes to radically expand the pantheon of human senses.
item.content:encoded: Neuroscientist David Eagleman has done groundbreaking work on how we perceive time. Now he hopes to radically expand the pantheon of human senses.
item.itunes:subtitle: Neuroscientist David Eagleman has done groundbreaking work on how we perceive time. Now he hopes to radically expand the pantheon of human senses.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 21: Neural Imaging and ... Telepathy? | Mary Lou Jepsen
item.itunes:title: Neural Imaging and ... Telepathy? | Mary Lou Jepsen
item.description: After stints at Google and Facebook, serial entrepreneur Mary Lou Jepsen is ready to upend the worlds of medical imaging and ... telepathy. Yup, TELEPATHY. Give it a listen!
item.content:encoded: After stints at Google and Facebook, serial entrepreneur Mary Lou Jepsen is ready to upend the worlds of medical imaging and ... telepathy. Yup, TELEPATHY. Give it a listen!
item.itunes:subtitle: After stints at Google and Facebook, serial entrepreneur Mary Lou Jepsen is ready to upend the worlds of medical imaging and ... telepathy. Yup, TELEPATHY. Give it a listen!
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 20: Radical Life Extension | Aubrey de Grey
item.itunes:title: Radical Life Extension | Aubrey de Grey
item.description: Aubrey de Grey is a highly credentialed scientist who believes it's within our grasp to REVERSE human aging in the next few decades. Dozens of scientists are now executing on his plan, funded by extremely smart backers including Peter Thiel.
item.content:encoded: Aubrey de Grey is a highly credentialed scientist who believes it's within our grasp to REVERSE human aging in the next few decades. Dozens of scientists are now executing on his plan, funded by extremely smart backers including Peter Thiel.

item.title: 19: A Lightning Tour of the After On Universe
item.itunes:title: A Lightning Tour of the After On Universe
item.description: A wide-ranging set of excerpts from the After On audiobook, read brilliant folks including John Hodgman, Felicia Day, Jesse Cox, Tom Merritt. Back to "normal" episodes next week, promise! :-)
item.content:encoded: A wide-ranging set of excerpts from the After On audiobook, read brilliant folks including John Hodgman, Felicia Day, Jesse Cox, Tom Merritt. Back to "normal" episodes next week, promise! :-)

item.title: 18: It's Really After On
item.itunes:title: It's Really After On
item.description: This week, Broadway's own January LaVoy and legendary fantasy writer Patrick Rothfuss read/perform the the opening of the After On audiobook (plus quite a bit more). With some notes & observations from the author.
item.content:encoded: This week, Broadway's own January LaVoy and legendary fantasy writer Patrick Rothfuss read/perform the the opening of the After On audiobook (plus quite a bit more). With some notes & observations from the author.
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, Broadway's own January LaVoy and legendary fantasy writer Patrick Rothfuss read/perform the the opening of the After On audiobook (plus quite a bit more). With some notes & observations from the author.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 17: The Past Present & Future of Cryptocurrency | Coinbase Co-Founder Fred Ehrsam
item.itunes:title: The Past Present & Future of Cryptocurrency | Coinbase Co-Founder Fred Ehrsam
item.description: Whether you’re a cryptocurrency novice or expert, this episode will teach you a ton. My guest, Fred Ehrsam, founded the world’s largest platform for storing & trading Bitcoin and more. Just us for a full crypto education!
item.content:encoded: Whether you’re a cryptocurrency novice or expert, this episode will teach you a ton. My guest, Fred Ehrsam, founded the world’s largest platform for storing & trading Bitcoin and more. Just us for a full crypto education!

item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 16: The Promise & Peril in YOUR Genes | Robert Green
item.itunes:title: The Promise & Peril in YOUR Genes | Robert Green
item.description: You will soon have access to a dizzying battery of facts about your health. Some could be horrid or positive on a life-changing scale! But most will be wildly ambiguous. Should you peek? NOTE: This is NOT just hypothetical.
item.content:encoded: You will soon have access to a dizzying battery of facts about your health. Some could be horrid or positive on a life-changing scale! But most will be wildly ambiguous. Should you peek? NOTE: This is NOT just hypothetical.
item.itunes:subtitle: You will soon have access to a dizzying battery of facts about your health. Some could be life-changingly horrid or positive! But most will be wildly ambiguous. Should you peak? NOTE: This is NOT just hypothetical.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 15. Music Piracy | The Extraterrestrial Threat
item.itunes:title: Music Piracy | The Extraterrestrial Threat
item.description: A vast alien civilization is so into American pop music, it recently committed the biggest copyright violation since the dawn of time. Against us! How should humanity respond? A special (and rather playful) episode with John Hodgman.
item.content:encoded: A vast alien civilization is so into American pop music, it recently committed the biggest copyright violation since the dawn of time. Against us! How should humanity respond? A special (and rather playful) episode with John Hodgman.
item.itunes:subtitle: A vast alien civilization is so into American pop music, it recently committed the biggest copyright violation since the dawn of time. Against us! How should humanity respond? A special (and rather playful) episode with John Hodgman.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 14: The Future (if any) of Jobs | Andrew McAfee
item.itunes:title: The Future (if any) of Jobs | Andrew McAfee
item.description: Andy McAfee of MIT is a leading thinker about how robotics and other automation will influence the future of work and jobs. We touch on some scary stuff - plus some delightful notes of optimism!
item.content:encoded: Andy McAfee of MIT is a leading thinker about how robotics and other automation will influence the future of work and jobs. We touch on some scary stuff - plus some delightful notes of optimism!
item.itunes:subtitle: Andrew McAfee of MIT is a leading thinker about how robotics and other automation will influence the future of work and jobs. We touch on some scary stuff - plus some delightful notes of optimism!
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 13: Medium, Twitter, and Networked Words | Ev Williams
item.itunes:title: Medium, Twitter, and Networked Words | Ev Williams
item.description: Ev Williams co-founded and ran both Twitter and Blogger.com, and is now the founder/CEO of Medium. He’s a deep thinker about ideas morph & travel, and is carving out a place for thoughtful, serious writing online.
item.content:encoded: Ev Williams co-founded and ran both Twitter and Blogger.com, and is now the founder/CEO of Medium. He’s a deep thinker about ideas morph & travel, and is carving out a place for thoughtful, serious writing online.

item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 12. TED Talks + Organization | Chris Anderson
item.itunes:title: TED Talks + Organization | Chris Anderson
item.description: You've probably seen a TED Talk or two (or 500!) online. Chris runs the TED organization, and has some fascinating thoughts both on how we're wired to process oratory, and how we might build a better world.
item.content:encoded: You've probably seen a TED Talk or two (or 500!) online. Chris runs the TED organization, and has some fascinating thoughts both on how we're wired to process oratory, and how we might build a better world.

item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 11. Space Archaeology | Sarah Parcak
item.itunes:title: Space Archaeology | Sarah Parcak
item.description: Sarah Parcak is a pioneer in the emerging field of space archaeology. In 2016 she won the TED Prize to launch a “citizen science” platform, which is finding lost sites and fighting archaeological looting throughout the world.
item.content:encoded: Sarah Parcak is a pioneer in the emerging field of space archaeology. In 2016 she won the TED Prize to launch a “citizen science” platform, which is finding lost sites and fighting archaeological looting throughout the world.

item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 10. Tech's Past & Future | Tim O'Reilly
item.itunes:title: 10. Tech's Past & Future | Tim O'Reilly
item.description: Technology’s pre-eminent publisher, Tim O’Reilly helped trigger the rise of the commercial Web, the open source community, the Web 2.0 era, and the maker movement. I discuss tech’s past and future with one of its most original thinkers.
item.content:encoded: Technology’s pre-eminent publisher, Tim O’Reilly helped trigger the rise of the commercial Web, the open source community, the Web 2.0 era, and the maker movement. I discuss tech’s past and future with one of its most original thinkers.
item.itunes:subtitle: Technology’s pre-eminent publisher, Tim O’Reilly helped trigger the rise of the commercial Web, the open source community, the Web 2.0 era, and the maker movement. I discuss tech’s past and future with one of its most original thinkers.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 9. Drones |Chris Anderson of Wired & 3DR
item.itunes:title: Drones |Chris Anderson of Wired & 3DR
item.description:
Chris Anderson was Wired’s editor-in-chief for 12 years, then started one of the world’s great drone companies.

We discuss all this – and his origins as a high school dropout living in a squat and playing bass for a band called REM (no, not that REM).
item.content:encoded:
Chris Anderson was Wired’s editor-in-chief for 12 years, then started one of the world’s great drone companies.

We discuss all this – and his origins as a high school dropout living in a squat and playing bass for a band called REM (no, not that REM).

item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 8: Fermi's Paradox (or, where are all the aliens?) | Stephen Webb
item.itunes:title: Fermi's Paradox (or, where are all the aliens?) | Stephen Webb
item.description:
Our universe’s vastness and age has given alien intelligence ample space and time in which to arise. Why can we detect no sign of it? 

This is actually a momentous and scientifically serious question. Yes, really! With British astronomer Stephen Webb.
item.content:encoded:
Our universe’s vastness and age has given alien intelligence ample space and time in which to arise. Why can we detect no sign of it? 

This is actually a momentous and scientifically serious question. Yes, really! With British astronomer Stephen Webb.
item.itunes:subtitle: Our universe’s vastness and age has given alien intelligence ample space and time in which to arise. Why can we detect no sign of it? This is actually a momentous and scientifically serious question. Yes, really! With British astronomer Stephen Webb.
item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 7. The Dangers of Superintelligence| James Barrat
item.itunes:title: The Dangers of Superintelligence| James Barrat
item.description:
James Barrat’s book “Our Final Invention” helped touch off a public debate about the possible dangers of superintelligence, which continues to this day. We discuss these dangers in depth in our interview.

For those who are reading the novel After On, Tom Meritt and I discuss pages 380-464 in the very last section of the podcast.
item.content:encoded:
James Barrat’s book “Our Final Invention” helped touch off a public debate about the possible dangers of superintelligence, which continues to this day. We discuss these dangers in depth in our interview.

For those who are reading the novel After On, Tom Meritt and I discuss pages 380-464 in the very last section of the podcast.

item.itunes:author: Rob Reid

item.title: 6. On Terrorism | Sam Harris
item.itunes:title: On Terrorism | Sam Harris
item.description:
Sam Harris is one of the most visible and controversial commentators on terrorism and its roots. Our interview dives deep into this subject, as well the personal journey that made Sam into the public intellectual he has become.

For those who are reading the novel After On, Tom Meritt and I discuss pages 289-380 in the very last section of the podcast.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: 5. Quantum Computing |Steve Jurvetson
item.itunes:title: Quantum Computing |Steve Jurvetson
item.description:
Quantum computers could be almost farcically powerful compared to classical computers. Venture capitalist Steve Jurvetson and I discuss how & why this is – and whether this potential will ever be realized.

 

For those who are reading the novel After On, Tom Meritt and I discuss pages 241-288 in the very last section of the podcast.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: 4: Synthetic Biology | Andrew Hessel
item.itunes:title: Synthetic Biology | Andrew Hessel
item.description:
It took 13 years and $3 billion to read the first human genome in 2003. Now takes #$1K and just hours. What happens when we can WRITE DNA as easily as we now read it?

For those who are reading the novel After On, Tom Merritt and I discuss pages 180-241 in the very last section of the podcast.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: 3: Privacy + Govt Intrusion | Cindy Cohn (EFF)
item.itunes:title: Privacy + Govt Intrusion | Cindy Cohn (EFF)
item.description:
In this episode, we discuss patent trolls, government hacking, privacy in the digital age, and other vital issues with Cindy Cohn, who runs the Electronic Frontier Foundation.

For those who are reading the novel After On, Tom Merritt and I discuss pages 110-180 in the very last section of the podcast.

item.title: 2: Consciousness & Neuroscience | Adam Gazzaley
item.itunes:title: Consciousness & Neuroscience | Adam Gazzaley
item.description:
In this episode,we discuss the roots of consciousness and other vital topics with UCSF neuroscientist Adam Gazzaley.

For those who are reading the novel After On, Tom Merritt and I discuss pages 51-109 in the very last section of the podcast.

item.title: 1: Augmented Reality | Meron Gribetz
item.itunes:title: Augmented Reality | Meron Gribetz
item.description:
In this episode, we discuss augmented reality (AR) with the CEO of AR pioneer Meta, Inc. Meron Gribetz. 

For those who are reading the novel After On, Tom Merritt and I discuss pages 1-51 in the very last section of the podcast.
